message:
You shouldn't. CPU-bound code is synchronous by nature, and should have a synchronous API.

If by "IO/CPU", you mean the method does *both* I/O *and* CPU work, then I cover that in the next article in this series: [https://blog.stephencleary.com/2013/11/taskrun-etiquette-examples-even-in.html](https://blog.stephencleary.com/2013/11/taskrun-etiquette-examples-even-in.html)
